abstracts.cdata!:
The Banking and Enterprise Sector
            Adjustment Credit (BESAC) is designed to support the banking
            and enterprise reform program of the Mongolian government.
            In addition, the Credit will help meet external financing
            requirements and support the budget burdened by reform
            costs. The adjustment program will tackle the main
            structural problems of the banking and enterprise sectors
            through an integrated approach that broadly aims to restore
            the banking system as an efficient and safe intermediator of
            resources, and to improve the economic and financial
            performance of select public and recently privatized
            enterprises. BESAC will support: the bank restructuring
            strategy including liquidation of the two insolvent banks,
            loan recovery efforts through the development of a debt
            workout unit (DWU) in the Trade and Development Bank, and
            halting the flow of loans to defaulting borrowers. In the
            enterprise sector, BESAC will assist the imposition of hard
            budget constraints, and passively restructure or liquidate
            six selected state-owned enterprises to jump-start more
            widespread restructuring in the rest of the economy.
